result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keith Lynn Harris

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Margarita L-O. processed and forwarded on 9/14/22 to the AP/Treasurer's Office on Invoice #AT000105 WF in court 2x on 9/6/22, 9/7/22.
Received and Filed. Victim Restitution Form

Defendant Keith Lynn Harris in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Keith Lynn Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court with Dan Flaherty for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
At the hour of 10:42 am, the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of

AS TO COUNT 1:  We, the Jury, find the defendant Keith Lynn Harris guilty of Battery as charged in Count One of the complaint.

AS TO COUNT 2:  We, the Jury, find the defendant Keith Lynn Harris guilty of Disorderly Conduct as charged in Count Two of the complaint.

which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Defense motion to modify bail denied by the Court.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.

Defendant Keith Lynn Harris in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Keith Lynn Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek with Dan Flaherty in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
DAY 2; AM SESSION.

Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court. 
Jury in Box at 9:21 am.
Defense rests. 
Testimony closed.  
Court instructed jury.  
Closing arguments by state and defense.  
Court charged the jury. 
Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 10:30 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Lohr and Smith who were duly sworn for that purpose.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Keith Lynn Harris in court.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Keith Lynn Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin with Dan Flaherty.Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
DAY 1: PM SESSION.

Jury in box at 2:30 pm.

Sworn for the state: Jesus Rodriguez, Milwaukee Police Officer.
Exhibits 1 though 13 received. 

Sworn for the state: M. L-O, victim.

Jury out of box at 3:48 pm.
Sidebars placed on the record.
Jury back in box at 4:00 pm.

Sworn for the state: Jimmy Morales-Colon, Milwaukee Police Officer.

Jury out of box at 4:26 pm.
Sidebars placed on the record.
Upon questioning, Court finds the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his right to remain silent. 

Jury released for the day, to return on 9/8/2022 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Keith Lynn Harris in court.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Keith Lynn Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin with Dan Flaherty.Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
DAY 1: AM SESSION.

Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  
Court instructed jury.  
Opening statements by state and defense.  

Trial proceeded. 
Sworn for the state: Anoma Stoiber, Dispatcher.  
Exhibit 1 received. 

Jury out of box at 11:58 am for lunch, to return at 2:00 pm.

Defendant Keith Lynn Harris in court.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Keith Lynn Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin with Dan Flaherty.Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire continued at the hour of  10:48 am.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.
Jury trial scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Keith Lynn Harris in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Keith Lynn Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin with Dan Flaherty.Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  3:43 pm.

Defendant Keith Lynn Harris in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Keith Lynn Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin with Dan Flaherty.Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
First call at 9:06 am.  Parties are ready to proceed with SPEEDY jury trial.  Case passed to address rest of Court's calendar.

Second call at 1:50 pm. Parties remain in jury trial posture.  State's motion for admission of 911 call heard.  Defense objects.  For reasons stated on the record, Court will allow admission of the noted portion of the 911 call for jury trial.
Jury trial scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. State's Amended Witness List

Defendant Keith Lynn Harris not in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Keith Lynn Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  Parties advise Court they remain in trial posture and have no further pretrial motions to address.  Court will address 911 motion on day of trial.  Case remains calendared for SPEEDY Jury Trial on 9/6/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Admission of 911 Recording
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Defendant's Motion for Dismissal.  (Keith L. Harris - #2022007186, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Motion for Dismissal.  (Keith L. Harris - 3C/36, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Keith Lynn Harris not in court, in custody.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court DENIES defense's motion to modify bail. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND (exires 9/12/2022).

Defendant Keith Lynn Harris in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Keith Lynn Harris in custody.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Case is in contest posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Any pretrial motions to be filed a week before the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed:

Court ordered no contact with M.Y.L
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Keith Lynn Harris in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Keith Lynn Harris in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
